Uses of Package
com.vangav.backend.thread_pool

  • Packages that use com.vangav.backend.thread_pool 
    Package Description
    com.vangav.backend.networks.rest_client  
    com.vangav.backend.thread_pool  
  • Classes in com.vangav.backend.thread_pool used by com.vangav.backend.networks.rest_client 
    Class and Description
    LatchThread
    LatchThread is a normal Runnable class that also uses CountDownLatch so that it does a count-down on the CountDownLatch after it finishes processing Sub-classes implements their own process() method that gets executed from the thread's run() method LatchThread is useful when a specific number of blocking operations should be run in parallel where the CountDownLatch is used to wait until all the LatchThread objects finish execution
  • Classes in com.vangav.backend.thread_pool used by com.vangav.backend.thread_pool 
    Class and Description
    ThreadPool
    ThreadPool represents the global thread pool for a service - Runnable thread pool is used for non-blocking operations like starting a new thread for in-memory operation, this thread pool is important to limit the number of running threads to avoid memory failure and processing congestion - Cassandra thread pool is used for cassandra's blocking operations - Dispatcher thread pool is used by the dispatcher to dispatch messages to worker services
    ThreadPoolProperties
    ThreadPoolProperties defines the default values and structure for ThreadPool properties
